info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 8:26PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COLUMBIANA AND NORTHEASTERN CARROLL COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 826 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Minerva, or 7 miles north of Carrollton, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Salem, Columbiana, East Palestine, Minerva, Lisbon, Leetonia, New Waterford, Augusta, Hanoverton, Rogers, Summitville, and Mechanicstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
